trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.

When an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> store is opened, the result is represented by an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.

If you are familiar with the unmanaged Cryptographic API constructs, you can think of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> as a memory store of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> class without any <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> information.

This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object, which is unlike the other constructors that use certificate or collection information to create the object.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> class using an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object to start the collection from.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> class using an array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects.
An array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> class using the specified certificate collection.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
Adds an object to the end of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref>.
This method adds an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> object to a collection and returns the index location of the certificate.
An X.509 certificate represented as an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object.
The index at which the certificate has been added.
certificate is `null`.

Adds multiple <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects in an array to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.

Use this method if you have an array of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects to add to an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.
An array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects.
certificates is `null`.

Adds multiple <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects in an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object to another <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.

Use this method if you have certificates in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object that you want to add to another <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
certificates is `null`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object contains a specific certificate.
This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property.
That is, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
This method determines equality by calling the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object to locate in the collection.
`true` if the contains the specified certificate; otherwise, `false`.
certificate is `null`.
Exports X.509 certificate information into a byte array.
This method supports content types that do not require a password.
A supported <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType"></xref> object.
X.509 certificate information in a byte array.
Exports X.509 certificate information into a byte array using a password.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
A supported <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType"></xref> object.
A string used to protect the byte array.
X.509 certificate information in a byte array.
The certificate is unreadable, the content is invalid or, in the case of a certificate requiring a password, the private key could not be exported because the password provided was incorrect.
Searches an object using the search criteria specified by the enumeration and the findValue object.
Use this method to find <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects if no user interaction is needed.

Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.Find%2A> method to allow the user to select <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects.
Note that this method can be used in a cascading or nested style, narrowing the search criteria with each call to the method.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType"></xref> values.
The search criteria as an object.
`true` to allow only valid certificates to be returned from the search; otherwise, `false`.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
findType is invalid.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
Enumerators allow read-only access to data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator"></xref> object that can iterate through the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
Imports a certificate in the form of a byte array into a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
This method imports a certificate in the form of a byte array into a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
A byte array containing data from an X.509 certificate.
Imports a certificate file into a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
The name of the file containing the certificate information.

Imports a certificate, in the form of a byte array that requires a password to access the certificate, into a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
This method can be used with a PFX/PKCS12 binary large object (BLOB) protected by a password.

Key containers associated with certificates in the PFX/PKCS12 BLOB can be created and the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags> value can be used to control this process.
Note that if you do not create a key container, the private key is not persisted.
This method imports a certificate byte array into a collection of certificates.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
A byte array containing data from an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object.
The password required to access the certificate information.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that control how and where the certificate is imported.
Imports a certificate file that requires a password into a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
This method can be used with a PFX/PKCS12 file or other certificate files that require a password.

Key containers associated with certificates in the PFX/PKCS12 file can be created and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags> value can be used to control this process.
Note that if you do not create a key container, the private key is not persisted.
Note that a PFX/PKCS12 file can contain more than one certificate.
This method imports the first certificate associated with the private key or, if no private key is found, the first certificate found.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
The name of the file containing the certificate information.
The password required to access the certificate information.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that control how and where the certificate is imported.
Inserts an object into the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object at the specified index.

If the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property already equals the capacity of the list, the capacity is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If `index` is equal to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>, `certificate` is added to the end of the collection.
The zero-based index at which to insert certificate.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object to insert.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is greater than the property.
The collection is read-only.
-or-
The collection has a fixed size.
certificate is `null`.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the property.
index is `null`.
Removes the first occurrence of a certificate from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
This method removes the first occurrence of a certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object to be removed from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
certificate is `null`.

Removes multiple <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects in an array from an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.

Use this method if you have an array of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects to remove from an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.
An array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects.
certificates is `null`.

Removes multiple <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> objects in an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object from another <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.

Use this method if you have certificates in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object that you want to remove from another <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> object.
certificates is `null`.
